title: Evil monster who raped and killed student, 21, before burning her body is jailed

An evil monster who raped and murdered a 21-year-old student before burning her body has been jailed for at least 30 years today.

Codey Herrmann beat Aiia Maasarwe over the head with a metal pole at least 13 times before he raped and killed her in north Melbourne, Australia, on January 16.

Her partially-naked body was found in bushes the following morning.

Detectives say she was speaking to her sister on Facetime when she was attacked.

(Image: Aiia Maasarwe/Instagram)

Victorian Supreme court Justice Elizabeth Hollingworth sentenced the 21-year-old killer to 36 years in prison with a non-parole period set for 30 years, 9News reports.

Fighting back his tears Saeed Maasarwe, Aiia's father, paid tribute to his daughter after her killer was sentenced.

He said: "It doesn't matter where I look, the pain inside is very big - cannot cover, nothing (can cover).

"She (Aiia) looked at the people, doesn't matter which religion which nation, which colour.

(Image: AAP/PA Images)

"What is your mind. Look at the people, same level, same eyes.

"This was Aiia. She liked all the people, all the humans. Doesn't matter where and when.

"This is how I want to remember Aiia."

Ms Maasarew had previously studied Chinese and English at Shanghai University before moving to Australia to continue her education.

She had been at a comedy club in Melbourne on the night she was attacked.

Friends dropped her off at a Bourke Street tram stop in the central business district at about 10.50pm.

The international student got off a tram outside a shopping centre and called her sister, who was overseas, to catch up, but as they were talking she was attacked.

She is believed to have dropped the phone as the "horrendous" crime was committed, and her sister then "heard voices" and alerted police.

(Image: Aiia Maasarwe/Instagram)

Herrmann repeatedly beat her over the head with a metal pole, sexually assaulted her and then covered her if WD-40 spray before setting her alight.

In June, Herrmann admitted the rape and murder of Aiia and he wrote a bizarre apology letter to her parents which was read out to the court during a pre-sentencing hearing.

It said: "I'm sorry. Your daughter didn't deserve such a terrible and tragic thing to happen to her.

"I will try to make amends for the rest of my life."

(Image: Aiia Maasarwe/Instagram)

He also added: "Don't give in to hate like I did."

Hermrmann's lawyers had argued that he deserved some leniency because a severely traumatic childhood had resulted in him having a personality disorder which gave him a "warped" view of the world.

Sentencing him Judge Hollingworth said: "Women should be free to walk the streets alone without fear of being violently attacked by a stranger."
